meanings.sent1: The government ratified the new law.
meanings.sent2: The committee ratified the decision unanimously.
meanings.sent3: The cat ratified the plan to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent5: The stamp of approval ratified the document.

meanings.definition: Make (a treaty, contract, or agreement) officially valid by signing or otherwise confirming it
meanings.sent1: Both countries ratified the peace treaty.
meanings.sent2: The parties ratified the contract with their signatures.
meanings.sent3: The robot ratified the alliance with a handshake.
